title: 11 myths about HPV vaccination you need to know - The Times of India
summary:
11 Myths About HPV Vaccination You Need to Know

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The article debunks 11 myths surrounding HPV vaccination, emphasizing its importance in preventing certain cancers and shedding light on common misconceptions that may deter individuals from getting vaccinated.

  • HPV vaccine is safe for all genders and can be administered up to age 45.
  • Myths that the vaccine causes infertility are unfounded.
  • The vaccine is not just for females; males are equally at risk for HPV-related cancers.
  • Series of vaccines can provide strong protection against various HPV strains.
  • HPV is a sexually transmitted infection, hence unvaccinated people remain at risk regardless of their sexual history.
“Vaccination is one of the most effective ways to prevent HPV-related diseases.”

In conclusion, understanding the facts about HPV vaccination is crucial for making informed health decisions. Public awareness campaigns can significantly help in dispelling these myths and promoting vaccination.
newTitle: 11 Myths About HPV Vaccination You Need to Know

What’s behind joint pains this winter? Orthos and nutritionists tell you how to keep moving despite them - The Indian Express
summary:
What’s behind joint pains this winter? Orthos and nutritionists tell you how to keep moving despite them

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Is the cold limiting your movement because of stiff and painful joints, preventing you from exercise? Experts say this is not uncommon because the chill triggers swelling in the tissues and bones, reducing the range of motion and increasing pain.

Key Points:

  • The cold causes blood vessels to constrict, reducing blood flow to limbs.
  • This can lead to stiffness and increased joint pain.
  • Experts provide insights on managing winter joint pain through exercise and nutrition.
“The chill triggers swelling in the tissues and bones, reducing the range of motion and increasing pain.”

In conclusion, understanding the impact of cold on joint health can help individuals find ways to alleviate discomfort and maintain mobility during winter.
newTitle: Understanding Winter Joint Pain: Tips from Experts

Gut microbiome: Fibre-rich diet, not just probiotics, strengthens your gut against harmful bacteria - Moneycontrol
summary:
Gut microbiome: Fibre-rich diet, not just probiotics, strengthens your gut against harmful bacteria

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Your gut microbiome aids digestion and plays a vital role in protecting you from infections. Recent research shows that a fibre-rich diet is essential for creating an environment that naturally repels harmful bacteria.

  • A diet rich in fibre from vegetables, legumes, and whole grains supports protective bacteria growth.
  • The gut microbiome consists of trillions of organisms crucial for digestion and infection protection.
  • Harmful bacteria like Klebsiella pneumoniae and E. coli can overgrow due to poor diet and inflammation.
  • Research indicates that the microbiome's composition can predict susceptibility to infections.
“Simply introducing probiotics to 'starve out' harmful bacteria isn’t enough. Instead, the focus should be on creating a gut environment that naturally prevents these bacteria from thriving.”

In conclusion, prioritizing a fibre-rich diet may be more effective than relying solely on probiotics for gut health protection.
newTitle: Fibre-rich Diet Essential for Gut Health Over Probiotics

title: Tripura High Court Seeks Updated Statistics Of HIV/ AIDS Patients In State - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Tripura High Court Seeks Updated Statistics Of HIV/ AIDS Patients In State

Date: February 20, 2024

Source: LiveLaw

The Tripura High Court has ordered the Tripura State AIDS Control Society to provide updated statistics on the incidence of HIV/AIDS to evaluate the effectiveness of current interventions.

  • The court is examining the steps taken to combat the rise in HIV/AIDS cases.
  • New ART centres and monitoring units are being established in the Khowai and Gomati Districts.
  • The Tripura State AIDS Control Society plans to increase its budget for operationalizing new facilities.
  • There are currently numerous testing and counseling centres operating in the state.
  • The court has scheduled a follow-up on this matter.
“Over a period of 5/6 years TSACS has increased the number of Opioid Substitution Therapy (OST) centres from 5 to 23.”

The court continues to push for transparency and accountability in the management of HIV/AIDS resources and statistics.
newTitle: Tripura High Court Seeks Updated Statistics Of HIV/ AIDS Patients In State

title: HMPV cases in northern provinces declining: China - Zee Business
summary:
Declining HMPV Cases in Northern China: Health Officials Report

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Chinese health officials announced that cases of the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) are declining in northern provinces due to improved detection methods.

  • Wang Liping, a researcher from the Chinese CDC, stated that the increase in cases was primarily a result of better detection technologies.
  • The rate of positive cases among children aged 14 and below has started to decline.
  • HMPV has been present for several decades and first emerged in 2001 in the Netherlands.
  • Concerns over rising cases in China were dismissed as part of annual winter respiratory trends.
  • India has reported about 10 cases mostly in children.
“Respiratory infections tend to peak during the winter season in the Northern Hemisphere.” - Mao Ning

The overall severity and spread of respiratory diseases appears reduced compared to the previous year, according to health authorities.
newTitle: Declining HMPV Cases in Northern China: Health Officials Report

title: HMPV virus in India: Does your health insurance policy cover outbreaks - Business Standard
summary:
HMPV virus in India: Does your health insurance policy cover outbreaks

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: [Source Name]

Seven cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) have been reported in India, raising concerns among parents. The government has called for increased surveillance, while schools and organizations warn the public to be cautious.

  • Seven recent cases of HMPV affecting infants and toddlers in India.
  • Government advice on enhancing surveillance measures.
  • Importance of reviewing health insurance policies regarding coverage for viral infections.
  • Major health insurers affirm that HMPV treatment is usually covered under comprehensive health policies.
  • Advice from experts about policy specifics, including deductibles and co-payments, and the need to review policy terms.
“The rise in HMPV cases this winter highlights the critical importance of accessible, comprehensive healthcare coverage.” - Amitabh Jain, Star Health Insurance

In conclusion, reviewing health insurance coverage for HMPV and maintaining hygiene practices is vital amid rising cases.

Is your Vitamin C intake enough? Know which foods have the highest levels - The Indian Express
summary:
Is Your Vitamin C Intake Enough? Know Which Foods Have the Highest Levels

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Vitamin C, or ascorbic acid, is crucial for healing, preventing infections, and maintaining overall health. Despite its availability in various foods, many individuals do not meet the recommended daily intake.

  • The recommended daily intake for women is 75 mg and for men is 90 mg, with certain groups requiring more.
  • Vitamin C supports white blood cell production, collagen synthesis, and acts as an antioxidant.
  • Key food sources include citrus fruits, bell peppers, strawberries, broccoli, and papaya.
  • Acerola cherries are exceptionally rich in vitamin C but may not be widely available fresh.
"Vitamin C helps improve iron absorption from plant-based foods and reduce the severity of cold symptoms."

Ensuring adequate vitamin C intake is essential for maintaining health, and there are many delicious food sources available in the diet.
newTitle: Is Your Vitamin C Intake Enough? Know Which Foods Have the Highest Levels

5 Dairy-Free and High-Protein Options for Vegans - Mint
summary:
5 Dairy-Free and High-Protein Options for Vegans

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Mint

A protein-rich diet can support muscle strength, enhance feelings of fullness, and aid in weight loss. A thoughtfully planned vegan diet can provide all essential nutrients, including protein.

  • Seitan: Nearly 25 grams of protein per 3.5 ounces (100 grams).
  • Tofu, Tempeh, and Edamame: 12–20 grams of protein per 3.5 ounces (100 grams).
  • Lentils: 18 grams of protein per cooked cup (198 grams).
  • Beans (Kidney beans, black beans, pinto beans, and chickpeas): Around 15 grams of protein per cooked cup (170 grams).
  • Green Peas: Nearly 9 grams of protein per cooked cup (160 grams).
A thoughtfully planned vegan diet can provide all essential nutrients, including protein.

This article provides valuable insights into high-protein, dairy-free food options for vegans, useful for anyone looking to enhance their diet.
newTitle: 5 Dairy-Free and High-Protein Options for Vegans

title: Boost your health this winter with these nutrient-rich exotic fruits - India Today
summary:
Boost Your Health This Winter with Nutrient-Rich Exotic Fruits

Published On: Jan 13, 2025

Source: indiatodayglobal

This winter, explore exotic fruits like guava, kumquat, kiwi, persimmons, and pomegranate to boost nutrition and add vibrant flavours to your diet. These unique options offer health benefits and exciting tastes.

  • Guava is rich in vitamin C, fiber, and antioxidants.
  • Kumquats can be eaten whole; they have a sweet peel and a tart flesh.
  • Kiwi is packed with vitamin C, fiber, and potassium, offering a sweet-tart flavor.
  • Star fruit presents a unique shape and mild flavor, high in vitamin C.
  • Persimmons come in two varieties, both offering vitamins A and C.
  • Pomelo is milder than grapefruit and rich in nutrients.
  • Pomegranate is loaded with antioxidants and adds flavor to dishes.
“These unusual fruits provide winter diets with variation and variety and also introduce an array of health benefits.”

Incorporating these fruits into your winter diet can enhance both your health and culinary experience. Don’t miss the opportunity to try these exotic options for a more vibrant and nutrient-rich winter.
newTitle: Boost Your Health This Winter with Nutrient-Rich Exotic Fruits

title: HMPV outbreak: Amid global concern, Chinese official says cases in northern China declining - India TV News
summary:
HMPV outbreak: Cases in Northern China Declining Amid Global Concern

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

The rate of infections with the flu-like human metapneumovirus (HMPV) in northern China is declining, according to a health official, amidst international concern over a potential pandemic.

  • The recent outbreak of HMPV has raised alarms similar to COVID-19 due to images of overwhelmed hospitals.
  • The virus has been present for decades, and most children contract it by age 5.
  • Symptoms include fever, cough, and nasal congestion, usually resolving on their own.
  • Current trends show declining rates of positive cases, especially among patients aged 14 and below.
  • No vaccines or specific treatments are available for HMPV; preventive measures are advised.
“The human metapneumovirus is not a new virus, and has been with humans for at least several decades.” - Wang Liping, Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention

The situation appears manageable with no significant medical resource shortages reported. Experts express cautious optimism as flu infections are expected to decline in the coming weeks.
newTitle: HMPV outbreak: Cases in Northern China Declining Amid Global Concern

title: 7 morning shots that help burn fat and reduce weight - The Times of India
summary:
7 Morning Shots to Burn Fat and Reduce Weight

Publication Date: Jan 12, 2025 | Source: TimesOfIndia.com

Starting your day with the right drink can significantly impact your weight loss journey. Morning shots are small, power-packed drinks that can boost metabolism, improve digestion, and help burn fat. Here are 7 weight-loss-friendly shots tailored for an Indian lifestyle.

  • Lemon and Honey Shot: A metabolism booster made with lemon juice and honey in warm water.
  • Jeera Water Shot: A traditional remedy using soaked cumin seeds to aid digestion and weight loss.
  • Amla Shot: A drink made from fresh amla, rich in vitamin C, to enhance metabolism and immunity.
  • Cinnamon and Honey Shot: A combination that helps regulate blood sugar and curb cravings.
  • Ginger and Lemon Shot: A zesty drink that stimulates metabolism and improves digestion.
  • Methi Water Shot: Fenugreek water to suppress appetite and balance blood sugar levels.
  • Turmeric and Black Pepper Shot: A drink promoting weight loss and overall wellness with curcumin.
"Pair these shots with a balanced diet and regular exercise for the best results."

Incorporating these simple shots into your morning routine can provide a boost to your weight loss goals.
newTitle: 7 Morning Shots to Burn Fat and Reduce Weight

title: Explained: How to protect yourself from norovirus, Covid-19, flu, and RSV - Business Standard
summary:
How to Protect Yourself from Norovirus, COVID-19, Flu, and RSV

Date: October 2023 | Source: Business Standard

In the winter months, many are susceptible to illnesses such as flu and COVID-19. Understanding how these viruses spread and how to protect oneself is vital for health during this season.

  • Norovirus is spread through contaminated surfaces and can lead to vomiting and diarrhea.
  • Common cold symptoms include a runny nose and sore throat, while flu symptoms can be more intense.
  • COVID-19 can lead to severe respiratory symptoms and loss of taste or smell.
  • Handwashing is crucial in preventing the spread of these viruses.
  • Cleaning surfaces and self-isolation if symptomatic are recommended practices.
  • Vaccines are available for COVID-19 and flu, but not for norovirus.
“If you do get sick, prompt testing can help determine whether you have COVID-19 or influenza.”

Maintaining good hygiene and staying informed can help mitigate the risks associated with these viruses during the winter months.
newTitle: How to Protect Yourself from Norovirus, COVID-19, Flu, and RSV

A California man has tragically passed away due to a rare form of lung cancer that was transmitted from another person, highlighting the potential for cancer to be spread in ways not previously understood.

  • This incident has sparked discussions about public health and cancer awareness.
"This case underscores the necessity for increased awareness and understanding of how lung cancer can manifest in unexpected ways."

title: What happens to your body if you eat raw onions every day? - The Indian Express
summary:
What Happens to Your Body If You Eat Raw Onions Every Day?

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Indian Express

This article discusses the health benefits and possible risks of consuming raw onions daily, highlighting their effect on insulin sensitivity and gut health, as well as their blood-thinning properties.

  • Onions are rich in sulfur compounds and quercetin, which are beneficial antioxidants.
  • They help improve insulin sensitivity and protect heart health.
  • Regular consumption can aid gut health due to their fiber content.
  • Potential digestive discomfort, such as gas or bloating, may occur for some individuals.
  • Blood thinning properties make them beneficial but caution is advised for those on medication.
“Eating onions with lemon juice and black pepper was a daily routine for me, and I noticed my immune system getting so much better.” – Vriti Srivastav, holistic dietitian

In conclusion, while raw onions offer numerous health benefits, individual tolerance varies, and moderation is key.
newTitle: What Happens to Your Body If You Eat Raw Onions Every Day?

title: Addicted to reels? It can cause high blood pressure, hypertension, finds study - Moneycontrol
summary:
Addicted to reels? It can cause high blood pressure, hypertension, finds study

Date: January 12, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Recent research indicates a correlation between watching social media reels at bedtime and hypertension among young and middle-aged individuals in China.

  • The study surveyed 4,318 participants, revealing increased susceptibility to high blood pressure with more screen time on reels.
  • Findings were shared by cardiologist Dr. Deepak Krishnamurthy, emphasizing reel addiction as a major health risk.
  • The study suggests that watching reels before sleep contributes to sympathetic arousal, heightening blood pressure risks.
  • Researchers recommend limiting screen time while maintaining a healthy lifestyle to prevent hypertension.
Apart from being a major distraction and waste of time, reel addiction is also associated with high #BloodPressure in young and middle-aged people. Time to #UnInsta!!

Overall, the study raises awareness about the health implications of excessive screen time, especially during bedtime, highlighting the need for moderation and lifestyle adjustments.
newTitle: Study Links Increased Reels Watching to High Blood Pressure

title: More children test positive for mumps in Alappuzha - The Hindu
summary:
More children test positive for mumps in Alappuzha

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Local Health Report

The Alappuzha district is currently experiencing a rise in mumps infections among school students, prompting health officials to take action.

  • At least five students at Eramalloor and four at Punnapra have tested positive.
  • The total infections at Eramalloor school have risen to 28, including a previous outbreak affecting 23 students.
  • Schools in the area have been closed for 21 days due to the outbreak.
  • Surveillance and preventive measures have been intensified by health department officials.
  • Mumps is primarily a disease in children but can also affect adolescents and adults, causing swelling of the salivary glands.
Mumps is a contagious disease caused by a virus that primarily affects children but could also infect adolescents and adults.

This outbreak of mumps highlights the importance of vaccination and public health measures to control infectious diseases among school-aged children.
newTitle: Increase in Mumps Cases Among Children in Alappuzha
